review_blob:
Bright straw yellow with a light creamy haze. The nose is full of crusty French bread and caramel. full flavored, long and lingering finish with some tart citrus hops at the end.

The beer had great head retention and was a pleasant surprise through out front to back. Not a malt liquor as noted here but more like a Belgian style blonde. The price is very attractive as it retails at $2 per pint (16.9oz bottle). Great buy,
